title: AB 1175
content: The State of California enacts the following. Section 9873 of the Business and Professions Code in California is amended to set fees for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers and service contractors. The initial registration fee is $205 for each place of business for electronic and appliance repair dealers, and $95 for service contractors. The initial registration fees for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers and service contractors in California are set as follows: $405 for dealers in both industries, $300 for dealers in one industry, and $500 for dealers and contractors in both industries. Service dealers or contractors in the electronic or appliance repair industry operating in California, without a physical business location in the state, must pay registration fees as if they had a place of business in California. The annual renewal fee for electronic or appliance repair industry service dealers is up to $205 per place of business, while service contractors pay $95 per place of business if renewed before the expiration date. The annual renewal fee for service dealers in California who engage in both electronic and appliance repair industries is $400 per place of business. Service contractors in these industries pay $475 per place of business. Service dealers or contractors without a physical business location in the state must pay registration fees as if they had a place of business in California. The delinquency fee is 50 percent of the renewal fee for a license, with exceptions. This section is in effect until January 1, 2019, unless extended. The director cannot increase fees before January 1, 2017. Fees in the Business and Professions Code are set by the director according to a schedule. The director sets fees for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers. The initial registration fee is $205 for each place of business, or $405 for those in both industries. The annual registration renewal fee for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers is $205 per place of business if renewed before expiration. For dealers in both industries, the fee is $400. A delinquency fee of 50% of the renewal fee applies. This section becomes effective on January 1, 2019. The fee for various licenses under the Business and Professions Code will be set by the chief, with approval from the director, ranging from $940 to $20. The section becomes effective on January 1, 2019. Individuals making pillows, quilts, etc. in their own homes are exempt from fees. Retailers selling only "used" and "antique" furniture are also exempt from fees and other provisions of the chapter. A person selling upholstered furniture and bedding must comply with fee requirements. If licensed as a furniture manufacturer or custom upholsterer, they do not need to pay an additional fee for a sanitizer's license.
